Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2015 01:00AM LolaHank wrote: Count me in, if your still counting! Diagnosed with bone/liver mets in October. After 5 years of being cancer free. NEVER thought this would happen again, absolutely no signs. No pain at all. Found at a yearly check up with oncologist. Pretty pissed off at the whole drug world as my onco wanted to start chemo immediately. I didn't even have another port yet. Only 1 arm can be used due to lymphedema. Got 2nd opinion at MD Anderson and started femara for 3 months. Will get results this week to see what is next. So happy to see ladies on here who are so uplifting and compassionate. You all are a rare breed! Pleasure to meet yall!
Posts.Title: How Many Are We? DivineMrsM kt1966

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2009 04:27PM LolaHank wrote: Bettina,  Take a big jug of water!  You will know once the first one is over what to take for the 2nd one.  Sometimes it was nice to talk to people, but it's okay to keep to yourself too.  My onc. told me to carb overload on chemo days.  I always started feeling crappy on the 3rd day and never wanted anything to eat.  Popsicles are good to have at home.  Be sure to tell your onc. of ANY symptoms you have, don't be shy.  Good luck and it will be over before you know it.  Rest, Rest, and Rest!!  Thinking of you! Sarah
Posts.Title: What do you pack for Chemo? BShoemaker Moderators

Posts.Content: Feb 24, 2015 03:55AM - edited Feb 24, 2015 03:56PM by LolaHank Hi ladies! I have Humana, my Ibrance script was called into Walgreens. Humana denied it. They say the drug has to come from the Specialty Pharmacy owned by Humana. I applied for the Pfizer copay one card and what Humana doesn't pay, the pfizer card will pay. I pay a total of 10.00 each script. They will send it to me each month via UPS. I get it tomorrow. Very excited but fearful. Keeping my fingers crossed that side effects aren't bad. Keeping the faith!  *Cost of the Ibrance for me on Humana is 10,361.20, copay is 2,590.30. The pfizer card limit is 25,000. So this will get me 9 months. Hmm, feeling fortunate to be able to use the drug but we all need to be millionaires to live.
Posts.Title: Palbociclib (Ibrance): Who would get this? RosesToeses Moderators
